abstract: Deutsche Telekom, the largest phone company in Europe, reported a fifth consecutive decline in quarterly profit after a strike led to more fixed-line customer losses.
snippet: Deutsche Telekom, the largest phone company in Europe, reported a fifth consecutive decline in quarterly profit after a strike led to more fixed-line customer losses.
lead_paragraph: Deutsche Telekom, the largest phone company in Europe, reported a fifth consecutive decline in quarterly profit after a strike led to more fixed-line customer losses. Second-quarter net income fell to 608 million euros ($831 million) from, 1.02 billion euros a year earlier, the company said. Sales rose 2.9 percent, to 15.6 billion euros. Revenue from abroad topped German sales for the first time after Deutsche Telekom lost 516,000 traditional phone lines in its home market while it added mobile phone customers in the United States. To help meet a 2 billion-euro cost-reduction goal this year, Deutsche Telekom moved 50,000 service employees into the new T- Service unit and cut their salaries, starting the biggest strike in more than a decade. The six-week strike ended in June after the Ver.di union agreed to a compromise reduction.

abstract: In the news today: Google and Microsoft battle with online storage, Universal Music tries to assert control, Comcast offers free Web video, and more.
snippet: In the news today: Google and Microsoft battle with online storage, Universal Music tries to assert control, Comcast offers free Web video, and more.
lead_paragraph: AT&T decided it shouldn’t be in the censorship business. It apologized for cutting out parts of a Pearl Jam song it was Webcasting that criticized President Bush. [AP]

headline.main: Quick Bits: AT&T Sorry About Censorship, Fraudsters Invade Second Life

abstract: Even with two days of sales in the second quarter, the iPhone seems to have helped AT&T increase its share of the cellphone market.
snippet: Even with two days of sales in the second quarter, the iPhone seems to have helped AT&T increase its share of the cellphone market.
lead_paragraph: For the record, it obviously is too soon to call the 2008 Presidential election. Or the winner or the battle between video game console makers Sony, Microsoft and Nintendo.
